newsitem.title: ESTONIA: EESTI KINDLUSTUS TO MAKE A PUBLIC OFFER.
newsitem.headline: EESTI KINDLUSTUS TO MAKE A PUBLIC OFFER.

text.p: Shareholders in Eesti Kindlustus, Estonia's largest insurance company owned by Hoiupank , decided to place 11 percent of its share capital in a public offer, the company said on Wednesday.
Eesti Kindlustus' share capital is 20.3 million kroons at present, Piret Kutt, the company's spokesperson, told Reuters.
Shareholders decided for a public offer because the company does not require additional capital, Kutt added.
Kutt said that present shareholders will give up some of their stake proportionally.
Eesti Kindlustus wants to list its shares on the main list of the Tallinn Stock Exchange in November, but at least 25 percent of its shares must be made public first.
The major shareholder with 85 percent is Hoiupank and minority shares are held by an investment subsidiary of Hansapank Hansa Investments, Pindi Invest and Finnish Profit OY.
Shareholders on Wednesday gave Eesti Kindlustus' council authority to organise the issue.
Shareholders also approved the 1996 net profit distribution of 26.3 million kroons. The company will assign 2.6 million kroons to reserves and retain the rest.
Eesti Kindlustus was privatised in July 1996.
